column4: All kidding aside, isn't there a way to get a higher screen resolution than 1024 by ...
either System->Prefs->Screen Resolution, or open a terminal via Applications->Accessories->Terminal to follow the !fixres tutorial
currently I'm running on live Cd. Will it work?
yes, but you'll have to redo it every time you reboot the LiveCD - none of your settings will be saved
you're probably going to have to manually edit xorg, like the !fixres URLs say
I'm not sure how to go about that.
I appreciate your help. So far, the info I'm reading is beyond me. I've got an nvidia card. Can you lead me through it?

hmm, I've got an AIT card, and it's always found the right res (1280x1024x75) on it's own. Ask specific questions about the parts of that page that're confusing, though, and either I or someone else in here will help!

I typed in the code to recognize my video car. But it didn't seem to work. The resolution options don't change. I've used the KDE interface on this machine before, so I know the screen can do better than this.
which part of that fixres page are you on?
start with "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg" - that'll walk you thru a bunch of config questions
once it says it recongnized my car, what do I do?
restart X - Ctrl+Alt+Backspace will restart X (and all your apps)
check the actual hardware of your screen - the width/height/contrast/brightness setting - wide black margins could be some width/height of display setting there
it works fine with the old windows the way it's set. I wish I could change it the other way, with a high screen resolution.
